main_definition: Shakespeare refers to the famous English playwright William Shakespeare, or it can also refer to various idiomatic expressions inspired by his works.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Literary reference to William Shakespeare, a renowned English playwright and poet.
meanings_and_examples.example: Shakespearean tragedy is characterized by complex characters and themes of fate.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An expression or saying that alludes to the works of William Shakespeare.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their love was as true as Romeo's for Juliet, but their situation couldn't have been more different.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used to describe something unintentionally humorous or ironic, often inspired by Shakespearean plays.
meanings_and_examples.example: That was a bit of a Shakespeare moment there when I tripped on stage and broke the prop!
